排.definition: a row; a line; to set in order; to arrange; to line up; to eliminate; to drain; to push open; platoon; raft; classifier for lines, rows etc

排偶.definition: parallel and antithesis (paired sentences as rhetoric device)

排名榜.definition: ranking; ordered list; top 20; roll of honor; to come nth out of 100

排場.definition: ostentation; a show of extravagance; grand style; red tape

排客.definition: paid queuer; person paid to stand in line for another

排射.definition: a barrage of fire; a salvo

排山倒海.definition: lit. to topple the mountains and overturn the seas (idiom); earth-shattering; fig. gigantic; of spectacular significance

排布.definition: to arrange; to lay out; (esp.) to set up (a trap)

排序.definition: to sort; to arrange in order

排律.definition: long poem in lüshi form 律詩|律诗

排憂解難.definition: to resolve a difficult situation and leave worries behind (idiom)

排擠.definition: to crowd out; to push aside; to supplant

排放.definition: to arrange in order; to emit; to discharge (exhaust gas, waste water etc); (of animals) to ovulate; to discharge semen

排斥.definition: to reject; to exclude; to eliminate; to remove; to repel

排查.definition: to inspect; to run through a checklist; to take stock; to audit

排查故障.definition: to troubleshoot; to check components individually for problems; troubleshooting

排檢.definition: to arrange for ease of search; to catalogue for retrieval

排毒.definition: to expel poison (from the system); to detox

排比.definition: parallelism (rhetoric); to arrange things alongside each other

排氣孔.definition: an air vent; a ventilation shaft

排泄.definition: to drain (factory waste etc); to excrete (urine, sweat etc)

排滿.definition: to line (a street); to fill up (a space); to be packed full; to fill up (one's schedule); to be fully booked; (old) to overthrow the Manchu regime

排瀉.definition: variant of 排泄[pai2 xie4]; to excrete (urine, sweat etc)

排瀉物.definition: variant of 排泄物[pai2 xie4 wu4]

排灣族.definition: Paiwan, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan

排炮.definition: to fire a salvo; broadside; cannonade

排班.definition: to arrange (shifts, runs, classes etc) in order

排空.definition: to drain out; to empty; to discharge (waste gas) into the air; to soar up into the sky

排笙.definition: reed-pipe wind instrument with a keyboard

排舞.definition: a dance in formation; choreographed dance; line dance

排華.definition: to discriminate against Chinese people; anti-Chinese (policy, sentiment etc); Sinophobia

排華法案.definition: Chinese Exclusion Act, a US law restricting Chinese immigration from 1882-1943

排行榜.definition: the charts (of best-sellers); table of ranking

排解.definition: to mediate; to reconcile; to make peace; to intervene

排走.definition: to drain away; to vent out

排起長隊.definition: to form a long line (i.e. of people waiting)

排遣.definition: to divert oneself from (loneliness, grief etc); to dispel (negative thoughts etc)

排遺.definition: feces; excrement; scat; droppings; to egest; to get (one's feelings) out; to rid oneself (of a thought)

排量.definition: discharge volume; engine capacity; engine displacement (volume of air fuel mixture drawn in during one cycle)

排錯.definition: troubleshooting; debugging; to debug; erratum; to arrange in incorrect sequence

排除.definition: to eliminate; to remove; to exclude; to rule out

排除萬難.definition: to overcome all obstacles; to overcome countless difficulties

排難解紛.definition: to remove perils and solve disputes (idiom); to reconcile differences

排面.definition: a row of things facing oneself (esp. a row of products on a shelf facing customers in a store); (neologism c. 2019) (coll.) ostentation; showiness; impressiveness

排頭兵.definition: lit. frontline troops; leader; trailblazer; pacesetter

排骨.definition: pork chop; pork cutlet; spare ribs; (coll.) skinny person

排骨精.definition: (jocular) anorexic girl; a bag of bones
